title: Linear Search
subject: Data Structures
theory: The simplest search. Check every element one by one from left to right until the target is found or list ends. Works on unsorted arrays.
syntax: for i in arr: if i == target: return True

interview_questions.question: When is Linear Search preferred over Binary Search?
interview_questions.answer: When the array is unsorted and small, or when we only search once (sorting overhead is O(n log n)).

summary: The brute-force approach to finding data.
